jobPostingInfo.title: Staff Assistant IV
jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Job Details

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

Responsibilities:

The Staff Assistant IV will be a member of the Earth Science and Technology Directorate’s Business Administration Office and will report directly to the

Business Manager.

Tasks include but not limited to:

  • Provide support to the Surface Water Topography, CRISTAL, and Sentinel-6 missions.

  • Arrange complex programmatic and conference travel, both domestic and foreign for project management.

  • Assist with managing complex calendars, schedules, and meetings for project management and senior managers.

  • Support complex remote meeting activities for the Project Office, oversee conference room logistics, and ensure equipment is operational, support multi-party and domestic and international WebEx (voice/data/video) sessions.

  • Provide setup and hosting support for Project Office meetings, events, VIP visits, workshop and reviews.Will assist in the development and preparation of review materials and complex graphics for conferences, reports, and senior management reviews.

  • Assist with the Project Offce significant events process, assist in organizing and transmitting data for monthly and quarterly reviews, and maintaining associated web tools and data.

  • Facilitate and coordinate with technical SMEs to effectively provide support (i.e with on-boarding and ensuring physical, JPL network, and data access).

  • Responsible for completing assignments that are discreet in nature and require considerable judgment and discretion.

  • Provide additional support to the Project Office that includes answering phones, processing visitor requests (domestic and international), ordering and maintaining office supplies, and other duties as assigned.

Qualifications:

  • Typically requires a High School diploma with a minimum of 10 years of related experience; Associates degree with a minimum of 6 years of related experience; or Bachelors degree with a minimum of 3 years of related experience; related required training.

  • Advanced understanding of both general and detailed aspects of work techniques in the secretarial or administrative assistant professions including knowledge of practical applications to problems and situations ordinarily encountered in a secretarial or administrative role.

  • Advanced understanding of executive office processes and procedures and applied knowledge and skills in this area.

  • Excellent planning and scheduling skills.

  • Advanced composition and editing skills; excellent typing, spelling, and grammar.

  • Excellent PC computer and MS Office skills proficiency in drafting original materials in Word, creating Excel spreadsheets and Power Point presentation chart; experience accessing and updating electronic libraries and various data repositories.

  • Ability to work under pressure on multiple complex tasks, and work independently to meet commitments and deadlines, and deliver high quality products.

  • Extensive experience with domestic and foreign travel processes, applications, and regulations.

  • Extensive experience with travel authorizations & expense reports; experience administering foreign travel forecasts.

  • Extensive experience managing multiple/complex Outlook calendars.

  • Ability to interact with all levels of personnel; experience working with senior and executive management.

  • Advanced understanding of applicable policies and procedures.

  • Demonstrated ability handling confidential and sensitive information.

JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique. This includes a variety of health, dental, vision, wellbeing, and retirement plans, paid time off, learning, rideshare, childcare, flexible schedule, parental leave and many more. Our focus is on work-life balance, and living healthy, fulfilling lives as we Dare Mighty Things Together. For benefits eligible positions, benefits are effective the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following the employee’s start date.

For further benefits information click Benefits and Perks
